{"id":572932356,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 years, 2 months","timestamp":1634520788,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"72 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/572932356/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"14.1 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1: ListNode, l2: ListNode) -> ListNode:\n        result = ListNode()\n        result_it = result\n        while True:\n            # add the vals from each node if they exist\n            if l1 != None:\n                result_it.val += l1.val\n                l1 = l1.next\n            if l2 != None:\n                result_it.val += l2.val\n                l2 = l2.next\n\n            # if the result is greater than 9, it means we have a carry, \n            #   so set carry to 1, and drop the 10s digit from result\n            carry = 0\n            if result_it.val > 9:\n                carry = 1\n                result_it.val %= 10\n\n            if l1 == None and l2 == None and carry == 0:\n                break \n            else:\n                # init next to a new node. initialize it with the carry value (0 or 1 depending on the previous digit)\n                result_it.next = ListNode(carry) \n                result_it = result_it.next\n\n        return result","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
